title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 27 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: lorry drivers deny m1 death crash charges .
woman injured throwing burning toaster out of window .
nhs cyber attack could have been prevented .
delays in mental health care affect anorexic woman .
bid to become european capital of culture .

documents.title: leicester city 2-0 everton
text: leicester city 2-0 everton
author: Stephan Shemilt
BBC Sport

documents.title: lawro 's predictions v anderson & moeen
text: lawro 's predictions v anderson & moeen

documents.title: notts county 3-0 newport county
text: notts county 3-0 newport county

documents.title: norwich city 1-2 derby county
text: norwich city 1-2 derby county

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: that 's it for the live page for this week , we 'll return at 08:00 on monday morning .

documents.title: police custody suite at newark to close
text: the custody suite at newark police station is set to close next month as part of plans to recruit new officers .
after 6 november , it will only reopen during peak times as part of nottinghamshire police 's our priorityplan .
the force claimed it will mean more can be invested in frontline resources .
it means anyone arrested will be sent to mansfield , bridewell in nottingham city centre , or graham custody suite .
chief constable craig guildford said : `` you will be aware of the budget cuts to policing but i am committed to achieve these by focusing on non-pay savings .
`` this will support my strategy to continue recruiting new officers , a position which makes us rather unique in the region , and investing in frontline resources . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man tied up during robbery at his house
text: a man was tied up and threatened with a gun and a knife during a burglary at his home in a 45 minute ordeal .
the man who lives in gunnersbury way in nuthall opened his front door to find two men who claimed they were making a delivery but instead forced their way in .
nottinghamshire police said the men took gold rings , bracelets , a gucci watch , a gold rolex watch and a south african krugerrand - a solid gold coin .
the men left the property two or three times to go to a parked vehicle outside .
the man was eventually untied before the pair fled .
it happened on monday at about 14:30 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested over two assaults
text: a man has been arrested in connection with two assaults in nottingham .
nottinghamshire police said the first one happened in leslie avenue in forest fields at about 19:00 on wednesday when a man was taken to hospital with head injuries .
the other was in duke street in new basford just before 20:00 on the same night when a woman was taken to hospital with minor injuries .
a 36-year-old man has been arrested on sus of causing grievous bodily harm and has been released while investigations continue .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stolen rainbows hos presents replaced by donations
text: a hos for children in the east midlands has been `` overwhelmed '' with donations since christmas presents for families using their services were stolen .
thieves took 370 wrapped gifts from the great central railway in quorn .
they were going to be delivered to poorly children at rainbows hos and leicester royal infirmary later this year - like two-year-old patrick with his mum vicky and sister phoebe .
news of the robbery broke yesterday - since then `` generous donations have been flooding in '' said the hos
east midlands trains offered to restore the shortfall in toys through its seasonal santa charity trains .
the warmth and generosity of the public has been overwhelming .
and we are so grateful to east midlands trains for stepping in with their warm-hearted support . ''
the hos has said it is now `` back on track '' with christmas presents and asks anyone who would still like to give to them to consider a monetary donation instead .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: uk cities bid for european culture title
text: uk cities bid for european culture title

documents.title: man jailed for 'insult ' stab murder
text: man jailed for 'insult ' stab murder

documents.title: weather : clear but cloudy evening ahead
text: this evening will be clear spells with cloud increasing in the early hours .
it will be quite cloudy tomorrow with some bright spells where the cloud thins and breaks .
there is a chance of a few spells of drizzle , particularly over higher ground , but most places should stay dry .
it 'll be breezy at times with highs of14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: large quantity of cash found in drugs raid
text: blimey - look at all this cash .
police said they seized over £ 8,500 executing a drugs warrant in coalville .
they also found `` lots '' of cannabis .
one man is in now in custody .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peak district road reopens
text: worth knowing if you 're off out in the peak district this weekend .
the road has been closed since monday for `` essential maintenance works '' .
snake pass is open !
ideally of it now - reopened .
if not a generic one is fine : - )
here 's one sent by a follower earlier this year .
thanks for letting us know - do you have a photo of the road we could use on the bbc website please ?
of it closed or just a general stock photograph ?
i 've never been so happy for a road to reopen .
added nearly an hour each way on my commute , and cost me more in petrol ! ! !
# sohappy
yaaaayyyyy i never thought i 'd say it but damn that makes me happy
woohoo
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: water customers receive threatening calls
text: severn trent is warning its customers in the east midlands about bogus threatening phone calls .
the water firm said some customers have reported getting a call from somebody claiming to work for them .
they were told their water supply was going to be cut off for not paying their water bill .
we ca n't stress how important it is for customers to check the identity of the person calling to make sure it is a genuine call .
we 're very aware that people can struggle to pay their bills for a whole range of different reasons .
we would never cut anyone 's water supply off - we 're not legally allowed to . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : puel 'cautious ' with local media
text: it certainly was n't box office from claude , who was cautious in his delivery as he addressed the media for the first time since taking over at leicester city .
the frenchman was considered in his delivery and avoided any headline grabbing material as he explained his footballing philosophy , which is of course his prerogative .
he said he wants a top 10 finish for the foxes this season and hopes for evolution rather than a revolution .
other than that , he did n't say a great deal .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: watch : halloween fun in nottingham
text: it 's all gone a bit spooky in old market square .
author: Dominic Johnson
BBC Radio Nottingham reporter

documents.title: woman missing for three days
text: have you seen this woman ?
police have said 31-year-old lucy chapman is missing from her home in chesterfield .
she was last seen in calow at around 23:00 on tuesday 24 october .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: second driver dies in head-on crash
text: a second driver has died following a head-on crash outside new whittington .
michael bradshaw , 72 , who was driving a ford c-max , was taken by air ambulance to northern general hospital in sheffield following the smash on sunday but has since died .
the driver of the volkswagen bora , daniel spooner , 30 , was pronounced dead at the scene , derbyshire police said .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : derbyshire police car catches fire
text: this is the dramatic moment a police bmw and mazda mx-5 caught fire after a crash in derbyshire .
robson green said he was in his mazda mx-5 in a queue of traffic when the rear-end collision occurred .
derbyshire constabulary has said they can not comment on specifics while they investigated the collision .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: food bank set up just for pets
text: food bank set up just for pets

documents.title: concerns over 'firework attacks '
text: residents in sherwood say they feel `` intimidated and vulnerable '' after a spate of firework attacks .
around a dozen used fireworks were found discarded in church drive on wednesday night .
it 's been claimed a group of youths were responsible and now some parents have said they feel scared to let their children leave the house .

on 19 october a group of about eight youths `` wearing bandanas over their faces '' were throwing fireworks , which caused minor burns to a woman 's leg in mansfield road , nottinghamshire police said .
in a separate incident , a 46-year-old woman then had her handbag stolen after a gang of up to eight youths threw fireworks outside shops in devon road .
police said a 19-year-old and a 15-year-old boy were arrested on sus of robbery and were released under investigation .
officers are now stepping up patrols in the running up to bonfire night .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham cheerleading squad heading to florida
text: a cheerleading squad from nottingham will become the first team from our region to compete in the world championships in america .
the killer queens , which formed in 2008 , will head to florida for the competition in april .
the group is from east midlands cheerleading academy , based in the meadows , which has 11 teams .
co-founder helena zarziki says the sport involves a lot more than just waving pom poms about .
she said : `` they have to jump in time and it is all about synchronicity , it is about being really strong and conditioned it is like going to the olym for cheerleading . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: singing stars coming to nottingham as part of record attempt
text: are you a fan of alfie boe and michael ball ?
the singing stars are in nottingham later as part of a world record attempt to do as many record signings in different locations in a single day .
you can see them at hmv in the victoria centre from 16:45 .
they were in blackpool earlier today and will also visit sheffield and manchester .
a big thank you to everyone who came to @ twitterid great start !
next stop @ twitterid who 's coming ?
# togetheragaintoday
have a great day cd came today love love love it ♡♡♡
meeeee ! ! ! !
just in the queue - see you soon xxxx
i 'm here in the queue with my mum !
we are very excited ! !
been here since 9:45 !
meeeee
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : puel faces leicester media
text: it 's the first leicester city press conference since claude puel took over as manager - he 's expected to take questions from the media about his new role .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: media await arrival of leicester city 's new boss
text: a busy one down at the king power - claude puel is due to arrive for his first leicester city press conference .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: labour retain two seats at charnwood by-election
text: the labour party has retained two seats at a charnwood borough council by-election .
the former leicester and charnwood councillor mary draycott took one of the hastings ward seats with 648 votes .
the other was won by james hamilton with 676 votes .
the by-election followed the resignations of sarah maynard-smith and anne williams , who both left for `` family reasons '' .
the overall turnout was 22.32 % .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: volunteers needed to help with neighbourhood watch
text: more people are needed to join nottinghamshire 's neighbourhood watch .
organisers say , although crime has reduced in recent years , it would like new trustees for the board and more volunteers to run groups following its re-brand .
the group is now known as notts watch and is keen to find more volunteers to help keep properties and communities safe .

sue sambells , a trustee from bramcote , said : `` with crime coming down , it does mean people are becoming more apathetic about neighbourhood watch and they do n't necessarily see its relevance . ''
sam said there is some money in the pot available for people who wanted to start a group for their area .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nhs cyber attack could have been prevented
text: an investigation has found the cyber attack which forced the cancellation of four operations and three clinics at king 's mill hospital could have been prevented if `` basic it security measures '' had been in place .
a government report says cyber-security recommendations were not followed , leading to about a third of trusts in england being disrupted by the wannacry ransomware .
all it systems at derbyshire community health services were shut down .
some gp surgeries in nottingham also went without computer systems meaning they could n't access patient records for several days .
this meant they had to use paper records .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lorry drivers deny m1 death crash charges
text: two lorry drivers have denied a string of charges following a crash on the m1 which left eight people dead .

ryszard masierak , 31 , of evesham , worcestershire , and david wagstaff , 53 , of stoke-on-trent , each deny eight counts of causing death by dangerous driving and four counts of causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
six men and two women , who were catholics from nottingham 's malayali community , were travelling in a minibus on the m1 near milton keynes on the august bank holiday weekend .
four other passengers were also seriously hurt in the crash on the southbound carriageway .
at aylesbuty crown court , judge francis sheridan remanded ryszard masierak into custody .
david wagstaff was granted bail .
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: watch : food bank for cats and dogs
text: a woman has set up a food bank for cats and dogs .
lisa parratt , from market harborough , started taking donations in september and has so far collected enough food for 500 meals .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: families get creative to celebrate culture bid
text: people are flocking to nottingham 's market square today to celebrate the city 's bid to become european capital of culture for 2023 .
organisers will officially submit their bid to the government but in the meantime parents and children are getting involved in activities back on home turf .
a 6ft high '2023 ' has been placed in front of the council house building for people to draw self-portraits onto .
the first 200 participants will get a free doughnotts as a thank you for their support .
this is the bid book which will be handed into government later this morning by chief executive paul russ .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal to find wanted derby man
text: police are trying to find this man who is wanted on recall to prison .
officers would also like to speak to liam potter in connection with two burglaries .
the 37-year-old 's last known address is rosengrave street in derby but his whereabouts have been unknown since monday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: helicopter used in police chase
text: using the your questions section of our website mike spathaky asked us : why are there several light planes or helicopter buzzing low over our house in oadby ?
he said he noticed the aircraft at 02:30 this morning .
i 've spoken to leicestershire police who told me their helicopter was out in oadby around that time assisting with a pursuit when a car failed to stop for police .
eventually it did stop on rosemead drive and people left the car .
a 17-year-old was arrested on sus of theft of a motor vehicle and failure to stop for police .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bouncing into the record books
text: it wont be a ty friday night for eight people in ashby this evening .
they 're attempting to break a trampolining world record for the `` longest marathon trampolining by a team '' .
james burrows and ian riley are two of the team members aiming to bounce for 25-hours at rebound trampoline park .
the world record attempt is about raising money and awareness for a screening event to check people for undetected heart defects .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: boost in popularity for your own pumpkins
text: a leicestershire farm where you can your own pumpkin has seen a huge increase in popularity this halloween .
cattows farm in heather started offering autumn pumpkin last year - this year they 've already seen a 242 % increase in sales .
owner james ludlam has grown several different types of pumpkins this year like the baby bear , which grows smaller than a normal pumpkin and knuckle head , with wart-like bumps on .
he said demand for these has been `` crazy '' and that they 've already sold out .
the farm has found there 's quite a lot of interest in cooking the vegetable this year with people asking them for advice on things like pumpkin pie and pumpkin soup .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman injured throwing burning toaster out of window
text: a woman burnt herself when she tried to throw a flaming toaster out of a window .
it prompted a warning from derbyshire fire and rescue service calling on people not to try and tackle fires in their home by themselves .
the toaster fire - which resulted in minor injuries - was one of three examples in the last week where people tried to put out fires .
another was mark thatcher from alvaston - he burned his hands and arms after he tackled a fire in a cooker extractor hood in his kitchen .
he told the bbc : `` until you 're in that situation you do n't know what you 'd do .
it 's a very difficult one to call .
`` i did n't think it was a massive fire and i just thought i had to have a go and try and kill the flames before the fire brigade got here . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: buddy holly musical suit to be auctioned
text: a 1950 's suit worn in the rock 'n ' roll musical buddy - the buddy holly story , will go to auction .
actor and tv director clifford milner has donated the suit to the rotary club of church wilne , in derbyshire , who will sell it at auction on november 27 .
clifford played j p richardson , known as the big bopper , in the show for four years in the 1990s .
the show toured the country and in london 's west end where it first opened in 1989 .
if the suit , along with an accompanying buddy holly fleece jacket , is sold at hansons auctioneers in etwall , clifford will supply a signed photo of himself wearing the suit to the buyer .
the lot has an estimate of £ 40-£ 60 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stall holders concerned about work on market roof
text: some traders in derby are concerned that work on the guildhall market roof will cause 'disruption ' .
it will be renovated from january but work is expected to last two years .
although many traders have welcomed the news some are concerned about the impact .
albert odisho , who runs mobile genie , thinks it will cause disruption to trade .

he said : `` i am sure it will do a lot of damage to the businesses especially on the perimeter of the market it will be very dark , we are at the back , in the middle there is plenty of light we are definitely going to suffer . ''
the city council says regular meetings are being held with the market hall traders ' association and discussions are ongoing to ensure minimal inconvenience .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: deadline day for european capital of culture bid
text: nottingham 's history of rebellion and social justice will form the theme of the city 's bid to become european capital of culture in 2023 .
the proposals are being formally submitted to the government today and there will be an event in old market square to celebrate .
paul russ , chairman of the 2023 project board for nottingham , said the bid was an opportunity to `` shout about the great things in the city '' .
a 6ft high '2023 ' will be placed in front of the council house building where people will be invited to draw self-portraits directly onto the giant digits to show their support for the bid .
the first 200 participants will get a free doughnott as a thank you .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: home secretary meets mansfield businesses
text: home secretary amber rudd has been visiting mansfield to find out about the homeless problem there .
she was invited by the town 's newly elected conservative mp ben bradley who has made tackling the issue one of his priorities .
it follows reports that some homeless people have been sleeping in tents .

ms rudd said : `` this is something that really matters to government , we want to support businesses , we want to support communities , so i have listened , i have been learning about what the particular impacts are here .
`` and i am going to be talking to other local authority ministers when i get back to london to find out what other support we can give the area . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a dry , bright and sunny friday ahead .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: delays in mental health care 'scary '
text: a woman from leicester has spoken out about her battle with anorexia .
it 's after a review by the care quality commission ( cqc ) said young people are facing long waiting times and unequal access to mental health services .
alice gibbs , who was diagnosed with anorexia at the age of 12 , believes a lack of access to specialised services had a long-term effect on her recovery .
she waited six months to see a mental health professional .
`` knowing that we had to wait for that help and things were only getting worse was scary , '' she said .
the cqc said these delays could be `` putting young people 's lives at risk '' .
author: BBC News Health

documents.title: foxes draw man city in carabao cup
text: leicester city have been drawn at home against manchester city in the carabao cup .
it 's a repeat of the 2013 quarter final , that saw the foxes beaten 3-1 .
earlier this week leicester city beat leeds united 3-1 in the fourth round of the competition .
claude puel 's men are now just four wins away from the europa league .
author: Owynn Atkin
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: travel : delays in the east midlands
text: travel : delays in the east midlands
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: man injured in helicopter crash
text: a 57-year-old man was taken to hospital after a helicopter crashed in a field in calverton .
nottinghamshire police were called to salterford lane just after 17:00 yesterday .
the man 's injuries are n't thought to be serious but the crash has been referred to the air accident investigation branch .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
